column1: Anarríma was one of the constellations set in the heavens by Varda to enlighten the awakening of the elves and gathered by Varda from among the ancient stars.
The making of the constellations (and of some new bright stars) happened 1000-1050 Valian Years after the first flowering of the Trees.
The elements of the name seem to be anar sun
Anarríma is not identifiable with an actual constellation. The word ríma might refer to the Corona Borealis (the Northern Crown) or the Great Square of Pegasus
column2: easily recognized from its four bright stars.
